projectDescription: This was the first personal webpage I created after I finished my WebDev class. It was created using node.js and Handlebars. It makes use of templates and reading in server-side data to render the page.

projectImageAlt: Image of the Tic Tac Toe Webpage.
projectDescription: This project, initally created as the final project for CS290 - Web Development, uses Websockets to make a dynamic, multiplayer game of TikTakToe. In this game, the turns cycle in a queue-based system, in order of opening the webpage. The game continues until Tik wins, Tak wins, or there is a tie. The game allows dynamic joining and exiting of players, constant syncing of clients, and a synced place-in-queue counter.

This is the current website, created using React and node.js. The purpose of this project was to teach myself some of the basics of using React. It was hosted on my Raspberry Pi, statically served by an nginx server (which also reverse-proxies some node apps). The nginx server manages the SSL and allows multiple node.js apps to be run. The domain was purchased using Google Domains, and a script runs hourly to update the Dynamic DNS. Now, it is hosted on AWS.

smallsh is a bash-like shell created as part of CS340 - Operating Systems. It uses POSIX-compatible system calls to exec programs, run background processes, perform input/output redirection, and more.
